spec.name: Laprad1 Fountain
spec.description: Laprad1 Fountain (likely named after French architect Albert Laprade, or located in a square he planned) is a decorative public water feature in a central Casablanca square. Fountains were a key element of the French Protectorate's urban planning, providing aesthetic focal points and modern amenities. This fountain serves as a local landmark, contributing to the civic beauty and providing a space for public relaxation.

people.comment: French architect whose work defined much of Casablanca's early 20th-century urban design, including public spaces.
